item.description:
Sunday, July 4
INDEPENDENCE DAY SPECTACULAR IN SALEM
TC: Mosaicwalks@yahoo.com

EVENT: We’ve found a scheduling conflict with the ferry and Salem’s fireworks as the 10pm ferry no longer runs, the last one is 9pm which is just before Salem’s fireworks however this is a great opportunity! The towns just N & S of Salem shows start when we leave the harbor! We cruise closely past Nahant & Winthrop’s fireworks and arrive in Boston for its show as well. David G will stay in Salem and can take people over to the 10:38 train. Enjoy historic Salem and a picnic that includes bands, pops concert, air force fly over and fireworks at Derby Park by the harbor.
After the picnic (about 8:30) people can stay at the park for the fireworks or take that ferry ride back into Boston (the ferry is only 2 blocks from Derby Park).
MEET: We will meet outside by the fountain in front of the Peabody Essex Museum in Salem at 4pm. Drizzle cancels
RSVP REQUIRED to:Mosaicwalks@yahoo.com (include a phone number and email address) for this trip, as there are many options and details including plans for the ferry so contact the TC by email, before July 3rd. .
Cost: No charge for the fire works, the Ferry is $9.50 each way and there is a $5 fee until you become a member of Mosaic of Mass.

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: INDEPENDENCE DAY SPECTACULAR IN SALEM
